hymcmcpy.likelihood_models package

Submodules

hymcmcpy.likelihood_models.likelihood_models module

class hymcmcpy.likelihood_models.likelihood_models.LikelihoodModel(forward_model, data, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for likelihood models.

This class connects a forward model with observed data to compute a likelihood function for statistical inference (e.g., in MCMC).

Parameters:

  • forward_model (ForwardModel) – An instance of a forward model used to generate data-like output given parameters.

  • data (array-like) – Observed data against which the model’s output will be compared.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for customization in subclasses.

abstract log_likelihood()[source]

Compute the log likelihood of the observed data given the forward model. Almost every real MCMC algorithm works better on log-likelihoods instead of likelihoods due to underflow in probability products

Returns:

The likelihood value.

Return type:

float

class hymcmcpy.likelihood_models.likelihood_models.PoissonLogLikelihood(forward_model, data, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: LikelihoodModel

Poisson log-likelihood model.

Computes the log-likelihood of the observed count data under a Poisson-distributed forward model, suitable for numerical stability and MCMC sampling.

Parameters:

  • forward_model (ForwardModel) – A forward model instance that computes P(k | lambda) via its compute() method or provides parameters.

  • data (array-like) – Observed count data, assumed to be integers.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments (optional).

log_likelihood()[source]

Compute the Poisson log-likelihood.

This computes:

log L = sum_k [ k * log(lambda) - lambda - log(k!) ]

Returns:

The sum of the log-likelihoods over all data points.

Return type:

float
